title: If multi-output math was invented, would there be no such thing as indeterminacy? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are multiple-valued function (such as the log and  roots) used in complex analysis, but you have to be careful with them. If you’re talking about indeterminacy in the calculus sense, though, multi-output math isn’t the fix. The calculus pedagogy can be fixed, but indeterminacy is a necessary part of the whole process. Some things converge to a finite number and have a limit; others diverge, sometimes in specific ways such as  does, and sometimes the situation is unclear. We can’t say for sure from this whether it converges or diverges, because just knowing it stays positive isn’t enough information to determine which happens (thus in-determinate).
